entry.title: View Epub and Mobi File on Linux
entry.content:
Calibre has stand-alone ebook viewer “ebook-viewer”, start it in terminal:

$ ebook-viewer <filename>

The only downside of this app is the long startup time.

I also tried view mobi file with okular on Linux Mint 14 Xfce. But its KDE mobi plugin “kdegraphics-mobipocket” doesn’t work.

Okular on Ubuntu 14.04 works better than evince. It supports j/k to move page. Toggle any UI components in [main menu -> Settings]. (updated in 2016.2.5)
